website_summaries.verdict: A worthy budget tile cutter with a sharp, easy-to-use cutting blade and surface.
pros: Large 24 inches cutting area is perfect for most tile sizes
Will rip cut diagonally up to 16 inches for tricky corners and angled walls
cons: Creates mixed results on long, narrow tiles that are easier to chip or crack while cutting

customer_reviews.title: Good cutter for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just finished remodeling a bathroom and used this cutter for 3 x 6 ceramic subway tiles and 12 x 24 porcelain floor tiles. It's a snap to use, but I did have to replace the cutting wheel midway through. I thought I'd get more life out of the cutting wheel, but bought a second one just in case, and I wound up needing it. The cuts are pretty clean, although I did use a rubbing stone to smooth out each tile after I cut it. All in all a good, well made tile cutter at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great. This was my first tile job. And I did a diagonal pattern. As if it being my first tile job wasn't enough of a challenge. I will never do a diagonal pattern again, but that's not the point here. I read some reviews where there was surface chipping in the area of the cut. I put down 13 boxes of tile and did not have one piece that did that. I'm guessing it depends on the quality of the tile. It's a simple device; measure, make your mark, score it, press down and it snaps in two. Seemed like a very well made device.
customer_reviews.author: John Brigan

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe cutting tile is this easy! DON'T PUSH TOO HARD
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe cutting tile is this easy! DON'T PUSH TOO HARD! Learned this destroying my first tile. If you push too hard, the tile will chip. Just rest your hand on the handle, and run it to the end. Set the "break bar" on the tile and give the handle a quick pop with your hand. My project is taking longer than I thought it would and this is much easier than renting a tile cutter from Home Depot or Lowes. Every once in a while you'll need to vacuum up the little chips of tile that build up along the base. This will keep your cuts nice and straight.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pavlicek

customer_reviews.title: Not sure but may be just me.
customer_reviews.text: I assume I may not know exactly how to work this thing. However all the ones I've seen to this point allow you to snap the tile in the middle. This one REquires you to snap on the corner which puts too much pressure on one side and always breaks the opposite end ruining the tile. Have it 3 stars because the thing it's built very well,. Can't complain about the quality. Maybe I'm just to green to work it.
customer_reviews.author: System Admin

customer_reviews.title: Seems easier, but unreliable results. Recommend a wet saw instead.
customer_reviews.text: This product just didn't work for me. The wheel is sharp, and the product appears well-made. However, despite all my efforts, I could not avoid breaking or ending up with mis-cut tiles. It cost me at least $50 in broken or ruined tiles. I wish I hadn't bought it. I should have put the money towards renting a good-quality wet saw, which is what I ended up doing in the end. That was well worth the effort and investment.
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Meara

customer_reviews.text: no guarantee of getting a 100% straight cut always.... in fact I only got 50% good cuts, most of it have broken edges or went the other way. So ended up buying more tiles and wasted more than supposed to. I tend to pray every time I have a crucial cut, cause just when I thought I already got the technique... breaks the other way.
customer_reviews.author: MäDmAxX ver.2.0

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it for a homeowner.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a game changer. I've read a lot of people having difficulty getting a clean cut after scoring. I had no such bad luck. At one point I just began to test the unit to see how thin a piece I could get. I was able to score and snap a 1" x 18" piece. Any thinner than that, it would veer off to the side when being snapped. Pretty impressive. The only negative was that the built in ruler and center line were off a bit. It took a few minutes to fix that, but it was easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Le Chiffre

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect! But does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered here on Amazon after receiving the same saw from HD, and it arrived damaged and beat up. No issues with this one. As for the saws performance. While it does not score as accurately as I was hoping, it was good enough. All the small imperfections will be hidden by the baseboard and quarter-round anyways. This saw definitely does help speed up the job...and practically no mess. I'll update after I complete all four of my remodeling projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mez

customer_reviews.title: Cuts poorly, tiles unusable. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: We wasted a lot of tiles with this cutter. If it could have been returned, we would have done that. Unfortunately we are outside the return window. We used this cutter on porcelain as well as ceramic. It did better on the ceramic , but the porcelain was extremely frustrating. It ended up making the cuts notched crooked on the bottom section, rendering the tile unusable. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: William Henshaw

customer_reviews.title: Not for all tiles
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent on my 12x24 porcelain floor tile, score and snapped with ease. But, for my 8x8 decorative tile it did not work very well, the cuts were uneven so I went back to the tile saw for those tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Ted S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money on a diy project
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper tile cutter, trying save a little bit more money. Tiled about 150 square feet, so didn’t want to invest in a good tile cutter that wasn’t going to get heavy usage. Well, as you can tell, I wasn’t happy with the other one. This tile cutter has a very heavy duty feel to it, and even on 45 degree cuts it made clean cuts. On the other tile cutter I also couldn’t cut 1” strip type cuts, but this one handled it well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: BEST SAW EVER
customer_reviews.text: Been a contractor for 15 yrs this is by far the best tile cutter i have used & the cost is supper reasonable. I let 3 other contractors i know try it & they all wanted 1 it will cut a 24x12 tile as small as 3/8 on the 24” side like butter.works great with glass tile even the small mats just scrore each one then use plyers to snap.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t have tiled my fireplace without this cutter.
customer_reviews.text: As a non-professional, this cutter allowed me to function as a professional tile installer. I followed the instructions and watched the video. The 12 inch cuts along the tile width were perfect. What surprised me was the ease and accuracy of the 24 inch long, 2 inch wide finishing strips I needed to cut. This tile cutter is professional grade, and most importantly, my wife was very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: The best dry tile saw I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller score saw and it barely would cut my 12x24 porcelin tiles - and not cleanly - so I bought this one. So a couple of minutes after this one arrived I pulled it from the box and set a score on my time. I pushed down a little too hard and it broke a little squirrly so I tried another one and barely scored it. It snapped perfectly clean, sharp and straight with barely pushing or scoring. I love it and cannot wait to get to my DIY bathroom tiling again. And it arrived a day early...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product
customer_reviews.text: As a weekend warrior needing to install 18" tiles in the bathroom, I needed this product as my older one only had the capacity for 12". not only is it a solid product, but VERY little pressure is required to score the tile. The "wings" which extend out to support the tile is terrific and the guides provided for cutting 5" and less widths are a lifesaver. Highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: No good!
customer_reviews.text: Been trying to use this several times over a year now and it is terrible. The cuts always end up either broken or skewed. I have to hope everytime I make a cut that it comes out straight. I want to throw it away but for the money I paid, it hurts everytime I think about it. I want to buy a different one but I don't want to spend that type of money again. So frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Fooron

customer_reviews.title: About a 90% success rate on 12 by 12 inch tile
customer_reviews.text: Used on 12 by 12 inch porcelain tile with a very light texture. Made 20 straight cuts and 18 were successful. The failures were at the starting end meaning where I'd begin scoring the tile. I think I used too light pressure when starting the scoring. I used snips to make round cuts and my failure rate there was much higher. Bottom line: be patient and accept that you'll have a few failures during your project so buy extra tile for mistakes and for future repairs.
customer_reviews.author: WendyB

customer_reviews.title: A Real Step Saver
customer_reviews.text: I had access to a tile saw, but for the most common (straight) cuts this was perfect and I could keep it in the room with me so it saved countless trips out to the garage where the saw was. The edges were generally clean and any roughness could be cleaned up easily with a tile stone. I didn't have great results with angle cuts, but that may be just inexperience. Certainly worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Chinterman

customer_reviews.title: Wasted Cuts Wasted Money
customer_reviews.text: The item is well built but simply doesn't perform. I'm cutting 12x24 tile and it will NOT cut the long length of the tile. The start of the cut always breaks and takes out a chunk. I wasted 7 tiles making the same cut before I quit. Save your money. Rent a wet saw.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Buy this cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! I’m tiling for the first time and purchased the 24” cutter for my tiles. My tiles vary in size, from 20” long to only 1.5”. This tool is giving me smooth, even cuts on all my tile. I watched a really helpful YouTube video to see somebody else use this model to score and snap the tiles before I gave it a try and I was able to achieve the same results. I would recommend this tool to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Worked Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I had a need to cut both Porcelain (wall) and Ceramic (floor) tiles. It scored and snapped both quickly and accurately. I also have a wet saw, but this was quicker and cleaner for simple straight cuts. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: I had to purchase double the amount of tile because so many are wasted because the cuts aren't snapping clean
customer_reviews.text: I am not getting clean cuts with this cutter. I am cutting 18 x 18 porcelain tiles and a majority of the time the tiles don't snap clean.I had to purchase double the amount of tile because so many are wasted because the cuts aren't snapping clean. Don't be cheap like I was. Buy a better cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but this worked great
customer_reviews.text: Tiled a bathroom and closet with 6x24" tiles, needed to do many long rip cuts. So much easier, cleaner and quicker than a saw. Some cuts did get a bit wavy or might have a bit of cleaning up to do, but was able to make small and large cuts without issue. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get in a rhythm. May have faulty cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Having quite a few problems with cutting my 12x24 3/8” glazed porcelain tile. The blade is ever so slightly off from the center line and I think it is causing some issues with clean breaks over the spine. Sometimes they are clean but often the tile is trashed. Chipped corners, wild cut lines, etc. Pretty frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: alicia

customer_reviews.title: I have to admit that I'm a novice at cutting tile so it may be more my inexperience than the product but I had a very difficult
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I was working with 6" x 24" tiles and needed to be able to cut them lengthwise. I have to admit that I'm a novice at cutting tile so it may be more my inexperience than the product but I had a very difficult time getting good straight cuts. It would almost always break fairly straight until the end. It did the job but it was not as seamless as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: bkmaster1

customer_reviews.title: It worked just fine
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended a wet saw instead of these cutters. He was amazed at my results. I had a small bathroom floor project with 4x4 tiles. Only one tile did not split exactly on the line, out of a dozen cuts. Otherwise it was very easy. One line, you press and you are done. You do not even need three as others are recommending. This cutter is for much larger tiles. But since I have another honey-do tiling for later, I bought this larger model. I could imagine that your results depend on the tiles themselves. Mine were very easy to split.
customer_reviews.author: Thierry T

customer_reviews.title: Better than a so called “best” tile cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on primarily hard porcelain and it’s a beast. I bought a 36” $700 Masterpiuma (a joke!) and the $100 QEP outpaced it everywhere concerning, again, porcelain. It works they have my money from now on. - 10 year bath remodeler
customer_reviews.author: curtisFSU

customer_reviews.title: works so good that it feels like cheating
customer_reviews.text: How long have you had this? works so good that it feels like cheating. I was running up and down stairs and out to the front patio where my angle grinder with diamond blade lives. chipped edges, huge mess, water everywhere. sooooo slow. If your having trouble with this unit then maybe -u might be pressing down too hard, maybe going back and forth, not starting at the very edge, Remember it's like cutting glass. your not trying to make a grove. Only score it. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas VanInwagen

customer_reviews.title: Better have plenty of tile.
customer_reviews.text: Was really hopeful this would work due to lack of mess. It did cut some porcelain tiles fine but about 30 to 40 percent broke with jagged edges. I was lucky that we had a lot more tile than needed for the job. May work well on ceramic tile. I didn’t try any of those.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamweaver

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: used this to tile a bathroom project, it's well made and sits well and firm on a bench or the floor, I used it for 14 x 10 ceramic tile, and 3/8 thick floor tile, worked well with clean precise cuts, very good product.
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: USED product - be aware
customer_reviews.text: This product was USED. The box it arrived in was thrashed, the black pad where the tile lies was clearly used with tears and tile dust. It looks like someone used this for a one time gig and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this tile cutter really helps when cutting your tiles to lay evenly
customer_reviews.text: we liked that it made it's so much easier to cut the tiles out when laying the new tile in our bathroom. we were so happy when it all came out looking brand new and tiles cut evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Robin N.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Tile cutter is easy to use and makes clean cuts. I DIY’d a tile walk in shower. This made super clean cuts and was super easy to use. Made a hard job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Tile saw
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well with my floor tile. They were 18 x 18 tiles and they fit fine. I tried them on glass tiles and got a little chipping. I bought a tile saw also so I used that on glass. It was very easy to use the tile cutter and it worked with every cut.
customer_reviews.author: phlyer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: A great buy! I am using this on 12x24 porcelain tiles, and it works great. It didn't come with instructions, (a few sentences on the outside of the box) but I watched a few how-to videos and was able to start on my project immediately. I am new to DIY and I have a wet saw but I used this for a few pieces. As easily as it worked, I may not ever use the wet saw for the rest of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy and Marc

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: I had a few people warn me that this unit was not of the highest quality and eventually it would get sloppy on the rails and not work well. Although I certainly haven't over-used the tile cutter, it worked flawlessly for the 24" ceramic tiles that I needed to cut on it. I would have no problem recommending this tile cutter for the cost of it!
customer_reviews.author: Keith J Neureuter

customer_reviews.title: but it made installing 900 square feet of ceramic tile easy. I believe the cutting wheel was wearing out ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this would work with porcelain tile, but it made installing 900 square feet of ceramic tile easy. I believe the cutting wheel was wearing out around the end of the project, but I'm happy with it and can buy a new wheel if I have another project.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I need to cut large tiles for my kitchen remodel. This tool was easy to use and accurate. Simple design and well built.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Very nice snapper. I did 900 soft of 12x24 porcelain tile and this greatly reduced my usage of a tile saw which is slow/messy/noisy. For long cuts be sure to give it multiple passes with the scorer prior to snapping.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor T

customer_reviews.title: Honesty
customer_reviews.text: Did not open until week after purchase. The tile cutter must have been a reshelf because the metal plate was bent from over tightening of the fasteners. This tool should have never been resold. I was so frustrated I did not attempt to return. You lost a customer and it would be impossible for me to recommend your product.
customer_reviews.author: Malfarr

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on backsplash tile.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut 4"x8" backsplash tile. It did a nice job. Sanded the edges after cutting. The cutter saved me a lot of time compared to doing it on a wet saw.
customer_reviews.author: robpgooz

customer_reviews.title: cuts thick porcelain floor tile!!  - but fixed end guide is crooked
customer_reviews.text: Love this cutter- works like a dream. But you cant use the built in ledge at the end to position your cuts because its very crooked. Its not adjustable either! A solid 1/4" difference from right to left. I dont know how these dont have quality control happening cuz its the actual mold that must be off.
customer_reviews.author: Janna m.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect DIY purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was cautiously optimistic that this tile cutter would be sufficient for my master bath remodel, and I was not disappointed! With the exception of a few special cuts that required a tile saw, this tile cutter perfectly cut my 12x24 floor tile, 4x16 subway tile, and 2.5 inch lantern tiles! For the value to quality ration, this cutter is a winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: C. Asplund

customer_reviews.title: Good tile cutter except the cutting wheel
customer_reviews.text: This tile cutter is very sturdy, well constructed. My only complaint is the cutting wheel dulls quickly and then you won’t get smooth even cuts. In some cases it broke the tile on a jagged edge. If they put a better cutting wheel on this it would be an outstanding tool.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Easy use
customer_reviews.text: I was able to cut a 18" ceramic tile. Not a perfect cut since first time use. The handle cover keeps coming out. Quite irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Hendry

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this board. Can handle a 2’ tile Easley. Was able to cut 2” off a 2’ board. Better than my ruby
customer_reviews.author: Robert Milligan

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: as long as the cut is right down the middle of the tile, it's fine, but not great for off center cuts. tile breaks halfway down the cut on longer tiles as well, guess it has to do with weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: BaylorBear07

customer_reviews.title: Broke More Than it Cut!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my tile every time I tried to use it. Just ended up using my wet saw
customer_reviews.author: WebSouth

customer_reviews.title: To make sure it does what they say it does
customer_reviews.text: The only disappointment i had with it was it will not cut properly with tiles that have designs implanted in the tiles It will cut OK on smooth tiles only
customer_reviews.author: lester

customer_reviews.title: Quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tile cutter. I broke one tile the first time I used it. After that, the cuts were straight and crisp. I tiled a very large bathroom and dressing area with 12x24” porcelain tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L.

customer_reviews.title: Forget about a wet saw this one is perfect for straight cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to but this as in the last I purchased a saw like this at Lowe’s. This is a great saw, used for thick tile for a shower remodel. Worked like a charm - perfect cuts every time!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to remodel a bathroom with 6x18 tile. This tool was phenomenal. I did need to rent a wet tile saw for only the very thin long cuts where I needed to trim 3/4” or less. All other cuts were simple, smooth and consistent. Good tool worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Allen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I will be putting in some small glass tiles in my bathroom. Most of my bathroom will be using 2" x 4" ceramic tiles, and I haven't gotten to the glass ones yet, but I wanted to go ahead and write a review, because I love this tool. It's quick and effective, and I don't have to run out to the garage to use the messy wet tile saw. It's making this job so much less work.
customer_reviews.author: d maul

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean cuts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do my mudroom/laundry room. Cut 16 inch porcelain well. Only broke tiles when I got tired. Probably my fault :-). Very happy with the quality. Very sturdy. You do have to adjust the alignment before you use it.
customer_reviews.author: James Pankiewicz

customer_reviews.title: A "must have" for 24" tile
customer_reviews.text: My tile saw will only do up to 18" so this was necessary for me to install a shower surround using 24" tile.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Welte

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be more pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Cut over 25 tiles with only one break error...which was probably user error. It's important to note that this was my first tiling job and this cutter made quick easy work for me. I was cutting floor tiles (24x12)
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you follow directions
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well for a first time DIYer - just make sure you use both hands (actually thumbs) with equal pressure when snapping the tile and don't use more force than necessary or you will break off small pieces of corners.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie

customer_reviews.title: Makes cuts with ease
customer_reviews.text: Liked product which can even score cut 1 inch off a 24 x 24 inch porcelain, do not try to cut less than an inch. I did not expect this inexpensive manual score cutter to be so good. Naturally this is a learning curve to understand pressure to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Works fast and easy. Great tool to have for ceramic tile
customer_reviews.text: Speed!!!!! Works so fast for basic cuts in ceramic tile. I had borrowed a wet saw as well and this is a million times faster and easier (and less messy).
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brantley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Really surprised at the quality of the cutter and the cuts!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Worked pretty good. Needed some practise before I started getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good. Needed some practise before I started getting good results.
customer_reviews.author: richard j. case

customer_reviews.title: Shut the front door!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Totally worth every penny!! It lines up nicely. I just took 9/16" strip off a 12" piece of scrap tile.
customer_reviews.author: bobbiejo wilson

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool when making straight cuts. A lot easier instead of setting up a wet saw. Having said that make sure you got a grinder set up as well because some of the edges aren't always 100% clean but that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Feels well put together and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting 1ft by 2ft tiles lengthwise has drastically simplified my installation. Cutting without chipping took a little time to learn, but once you build your technique, it was pretty reliable.Tool is very robust.
customer_reviews.author: rabid jackal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Even a novice can cut tile precisely using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: MAT

customer_reviews.title: Much larger and stronger than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Cut tiles easily. capacity to cut much larger tiles than my job required.
customer_reviews.author: mat

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I used this tile scorer to do the backsplash of our kitchen. We used glass and porcelain mosaic tile (small 1x4"). This tool was awesome, the scores were perfect and it snapped the tiles without creating an shards or splintering. I would buy this product again! very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fritsch

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, makes smooth cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to cut ceramic tiles for a bathroom remodel. The tiles were 10 x 16, the cutter handled them with room to spare. There was a bit of a learning curve, I tended to push too hard when scribing which caused the edges to be a little rough. Once I lightened up when scribing the cuts came out perfect. It doesn’t take much to pressure to scribe the tile. I had to cut two dozen tiles and it is still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Louann

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: First cut on 24" porcelain tile was perfect. Very quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Salemi

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, after very short testing I manage to work with it. the side supports are not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: first class item
customer_reviews.text: strong and super well made. a quality item. cuts thick hard tile, with a little feather at the end of the cut
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Why have I gone without it for so long?.....
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter. Amazing quality aside from 2 large tile support bars, they are just too loose in their mounting holes.... But if the cutter is sitting on a flat surface - it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Solid tile cutter. Clean straight cuts on large 18 inch ceramic tiles. Heavy duty and worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Works like other reviews state including not being able to do 1.75" cuts or less. Only one I have tried so maybe a limitation for all? VERY HAPPY WITH QUALITY AND FUNCTION!!
customer_reviews.author: Conrod

customer_reviews.title: great tile cutter
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut 12 x 24 ceramic tile and it worked great - was able to cut as little as 3/4 in off a 24 long tile with perfect accuracy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for small jobs that don't require a tile saw
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my small porch tile job. Heavy and decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: fixit

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this cutter if you want a quality cut for your ceramic tiles!
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to cut even one tile without breakage. I followed every instruction to the end. I had this cutter sitting idle for a month before I tried using it, and now I'm stuck with it because of the 30 day return rule. Junk and very dissatisfied with the product. Zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: kristi williamson

customer_reviews.title: good cutter
customer_reviews.text: cut ceramic tiles like cheese i do not use it on procelain as yet but good cutter!!*
customer_reviews.author: madieo

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: Would have give 5 stars if plastic didnt fall out of arm
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Was skeptical at first but once I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product!Was skeptical at first but once I started using it I was sold.I installed a 12x12 kitchen with porcelain tile and 100 % of my cuts with the QEP 10630Q were perfect..
customer_reviews.author: Christine Newell

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the SECOND cut
customer_reviews.text: Its a shame that my DIY projects take so long, or else I would be returning this immediately. The cutter foot snapped and broke on the second cut using this thing. Enough pressure to break the tile, and the foot snapped in two pieces and is now completely unusable. What an utter and complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and stable
customer_reviews.text: This cutter is heavy duty and worked well on a large tile job. Very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Knowing this is a "Low-End" tile cutter it is good. You must make a good consistent score and a consistent snap, either one is off it won't cut good. I'm using on porcelain, again its ok but YOU must be very consistent, don't try to be fast!!
customer_reviews.author: Nickelboy

customer_reviews.title: It worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Used this tool to do a small shower wall tile job. It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Will get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Well with it. Snaps like you want it to. Sad I didn't buy it earlier. Performed great with porcelain. Had to adjust how much pressure I use when I went back to using ceramic. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kay B

customer_reviews.title: 12 x 24 porcelain tile
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do great with 12 x 24 porcelain tile. I wasted 3 tiles before giving up. It would snap straight all the way till the last half inch at the bottom then break off a curved piece. Didn't do that with some ceramic. I recommend renting a wet saw for porcelain tile. I'd return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Clean breaks with this easy to use cutter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut tile for a small project. Was able to score and break tile easily and without many miss-breaks. Very clean breaks. Did not even need to clean up edges. Strong stable heavy machine. Very affordable for my small project
customer_reviews.author: mu1yvi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool.
customer_reviews.text: We were able (with patience of course) to cut a 1/4 inch strips out of glass tile, excellent tile cutter.
customer_reviews.author: ViLo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice to be able to cut 24" tiles without too much hastle. Works well
customer_reviews.author: Pete of Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Box was torn, and missing the angle fence. Other than that, this is a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Txmmoore

customer_reviews.title: I cut 12" x 24" the long way and it worked great. It's much faster and cleaner than using the ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a wet saw for cuts on porcelain tile and now I use this for straight cuts. I cut 12" x 24" the long way and it worked great. It's much faster and cleaner than using the wet saw for that type of cut.
customer_reviews.author: D NY

customer_reviews.title: Previously used
customer_reviews.text: The item I received had been previously used. There were scratches on the deck right at 18". It was obvious that someone cut 18" tiles on this tile cutter. It was covered in tile grit and the paint was chipped.
customer_reviews.author: J Rice

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: After buying cheaper tile cutters, this cutter was a great surprise. Great Quality, precision, and price. Love the extension arms. The con about the product is “Made In China.”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did a good job
customer_reviews.text: Did the job well. Good cuts with porcelain tiles. No complains. Seems sturdy and well made. Once you get use to the feel, cuts and know-how. It will be a breeze. Give it 4 stars for effectiveness and quality.
customer_reviews.author: I TELL U THE TRUTH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for cutting large format (24 inch) porcelain tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio42

customer_reviews.title: Turned a tough project into an easy one man project
customer_reviews.text: This manual tile cutter saved me bug time for an in-laws family room add-on ceramic floor tile project! Turned a tough project into an easy one man project. I'll never use a wet saw, tile nippers or a masonry grinder again to cut large floor tile!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to tile 2 showers with subway tile and 2 floors in small bathrooms. This thing worked perfectly. The only negative - it is a bit heavy and clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DePinto

customer_reviews.title: ... I figured out the process of cutting tile worked good the blade dulled quick but worked fine
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the process of cutting tile worked good the blade dulled quick but worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: steve scroggins

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It took me a few tries to get the hang of it but I am now having fun using this to cut tiles for art project.
customer_reviews.author: A_TheRiot

customer_reviews.title: Should work great for tiles smaller than 2'
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble chipping 2' tiles on the corner opposite the cutting wheel on such long tiles. Should work great for tiles smaller than 2'.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Polo

product_meta.title: QEP 10630Q 24-Inch Manual Tile Cutter with Tungsten Carbide Scoring Wheel for Porcelain and Ceramic Tiles
product_meta.description: The QEP model 10630Q 24-Inch (630mm) Manual Tile Cutter is designed for both ceramic and porcelain tile. The simple score and snap process is a quick way to rip and diagonally cut tiles. The dual, chrome-plated rugged steel rails and linear ball bearing slides are designed for smooth scoring on large tiles. The wide aluminum alloy base, heavy duty rubber pads and cutting table extensions provide extra stability for larger, heavier tiles. The high leverage bicycle grip handle makes cutting easier. Includes a 7/8-Inch titanium-coated tungsten-carbide scoring wheel.
feature_bullets: Rip cuts porcelain and ceramic tile up to 24-Inch and 17.5-Inch diagonally
Straight edge adjustable measurement guide aligns tile for accurate cutting
7/8-Inch titanium-coated tungsten-carbide cutting wheel for smooth and durable scoring
Easily cleaned with compressed air or soap and water if needed
